column4: is it possible to make Gnome pre-load all the desktop icons, visuals and everything into memory before the desktop appears? as windows does.
is it possible to make Gnome pre-load all the desktop icons, visuals and everything into memory before the desktop appears? as windows does.
No, because the icons, visuals, and everything, are provided by separate processes running under the gnome-session process.  It's not a monolithic subsystem like Windows' GDU+USER interface.
what should I do then? theres always a delay when I first try to open up something, like the gnome menu for instance, it takes a quarter second
There should be no delay after you've opened the menu the first time.  Is there?
